London

Timetric is looking for software engineers to join our small London-based team, and help us build great data visualization products. We build software around economic data. We collect it, analyze it and visualize it; we provide tools for our users to explore, use and reuse it.

We want you to help us bring our data visualization tools to a wider audience.

The Timetric platform was built from the ground up on Python (Django) and Javascript, with a Postgres/Solr/Redis backend. We try to stay close to the cutting edge of new technologies, and we're always open to new ideas.

You'll be joining a small team, with a minimum of process. Code is deployed continuously and we can provision a server with one click.

Required: * Good level of expertise in either Python or Javascript (or both!) * Comfortable working knowledge of Linux * Used to working with git (or mercurial/bzr)

Bonus points for any of: * Interest in data visualization * Numerical/scientific/mathematical background * Understanding of AI/ML techniques * Interest in economics

Send your CV/covering letter or questions to jobs@timetric.com
